title: Depreciation Basics
description: Learn how to calculate asset depreciation and understand its impact on your financial planning.

steps.title: Understanding Depreciation
steps.content: Depreciation is the decrease in value of an asset over time. This concept is crucial for understanding the true cost of ownership for vehicles, equipment, and other assets.

steps.title: Calculate Your Car's Depreciation
steps.content: Use this calculator to determine how much value your car loses each year. This helps in making informed decisions about buying new vs. used vehicles.

steps.title: Making Smart Purchase Decisions
steps.content: Now that you understand depreciation, consider how it affects major purchases. A R300,000 car that depreciates 20% annually will lose R60,000 in its first year alone.

title: Emergency Fund Planning
description: Build a solid emergency fund that can weather any financial storm.

steps.title: Why Emergency Funds Matter
steps.content: An emergency fund is your financial safety net. It protects you from debt when unexpected expenses arise, like medical bills or job loss.

steps.title: Calculate Your Target Amount
steps.content: Most experts recommend 3-6 months of expenses. Calculate your monthly essential expenses (rent, food, utilities, minimum debt payments) and multiply by your comfort level.

steps.title: Building Your Fund Gradually
steps.content: Start small - even R500 can handle minor emergencies. Automate transfers to make saving effortless. Treat your emergency fund contributions like a non-negotiable bill.

title: Mindful Spending Habits
description: Develop awareness around your spending patterns and build healthier financial habits.

steps.title: The Psychology of Spending
steps.content: Our spending is often driven by emotions, social pressure, and unconscious habits. Understanding these triggers is the first step to mindful money management.

steps.title: The 24-Hour Rule
steps.content: Before making any non-essential purchase over R200, wait 24 hours. This simple pause often reveals whether the purchase aligns with your values and goals.

steps.title: Values-Based Spending
steps.content: Identify your top 5 values (family, health, education, etc.). Evaluate purchases against these values. Money spent on things you truly value feels less like expense and more like investment.

title: Career Advancement Strategy
description: Build a strategic approach to advancing your career and increasing your earning potential.

steps.title: Assess Your Current Position
steps.content: Honestly evaluate your skills, experience, and market value. Use salary surveys and job postings to understand your worth in the current market.

steps.title: Identify Growth Opportunities
steps.content: Look for skills gaps in your industry. What skills are in high demand? What certifications or training could increase your value? Focus on skills that multiply your impact.

steps.title: Build Your Professional Network
steps.content: Networking isn't about using people - it's about building genuine professional relationships. Attend industry events, engage on LinkedIn, and always look for ways to help others first.
